ko: 특수 컴퓨터 시스템을 만들어서 휠체어에 달아줬어.

en: They advanced on the enemy.
They went to Tottori.
They have brown skin and black hair.
They like Tsuneoki Ikeda.
They make up about 12.5 percent of the total population.
They were very tired indeed.
They're going to Ishikawa.
They are human.
They are better educated, healthier and wealthier than their parents' generation was at their age.
ko: 걔네는 부모님 세대가 그들 나이였을 때보다 교육도 더 잘 받았고, 더 건강하고 더 부유해.

en: They don't have enough income to lay aside for the future.
ko: 걔네는 미래를 위해 저축할 만큼 수입이 충분하지 않아.

en: They forgot all about Noah, who had saved them.
ko: 걔네는 자신들을 구해준 노아에 대해 완전히 잊어버렸어.

en: They call me captain.
They are my cousins.
They paid their compliment to me.
They greeted me.
They don't like me.
They study industry.
They went fishing yesterday.
They came from all over the world to make their homes in this new land, which was thinly populated by native Indians.
ko: 인디언 원주민들이 드문드문 살던 이 새로운 땅에 정착하려고 전 세계에서 사람들이 몰려왔어.

en: They have decided to stick to the original plan after all.
ko: 걔네 결국 원래 계획대로 하기로 했어.

en: They extend kindness to their neighbors.
They elected Hashimoto the Prime Minister.
They want to talk to you about areas of mutual interest.
ko: 걔네가 서로 관심 있는 분야에 대해 너랑 얘기하고 싶어 해.

en: They stressed protection of the environment.
They can sense the approach of cold weather.
ko: 걔네는 추운 날씨가 다가오는 걸 느낄 수 있어.

en: They dropped out of their school.
They dropped out of school.
They climbed to the top of a cliff.
They demanded that the company pay them more.
ko: 걔네는 회사가 월급을 더 줘야 한다고 요구했어.

en: They are artists.
They are singers.
They want, above all things, to live in peace.
They stopped the music.
They stood up and made their speeches one by one.
ko: 걔네는 일어서서 한 명씩 연설을 했어.

en: They are doctors.
They will buy a record.
By and by you will forget the painful experience.
ko: 곧 그 아픈 경험은 잊게 될 거야.

en: They seldom, if ever, quarrel with each other.
They are planning to settle in New Zealand.
They are crying down Tom's new theory.
ko: 걔네는 톰의 새로운 이론을 깎아내리고 있어.

en: They lived on corn, potatoes, and the meat of animals.
ko: 걔네는 옥수수, 감자, 그리고 고기를 먹고 살았어.

en: When they moved to the town, they found it easy to make friends.
ko: 마을로 이사 왔을 때, 걔네는 친구 사귀는 게 쉽다는 걸 알게 됐어.

en: They did not agree to bring down the price.
ko: 걔네는 가격을 내리는 거에 동의하지 않았어.

en: They admired the fine view from the hill.
ko: 걔네는 언덕에서 보이는 멋진 풍경에 감탄했어.

en: They drink coke.
They drink cola.
They have branches all over the world, from Calcutta to New York City.
ko: 걔네는 캘커타에서 뉴욕까지 전 세계에 지점을 두고 있어.

en: They walk arm in arm with each other.
They stayed up late talking.
They have formed their own nationwide association, the American Association of Retired Persons.
ko: 걔네는 미국 은퇴자 협회라는 자신들만의 전국적인 단체를 만들었어.

en: They wanted change now.
They spread the Gospel all over the world.
Their talks centered on their trip.
ko: 걔네 얘기는 주로 여행에 관한 거였어.

en: Their conversation being in Chinese, I did not understand one word.
ko: 걔네가 중국어로 말해서 한 마디도 못 알아들었어.

en: According to what they say, that boy is very good at singing.
ko: 걔네 말로는 그 애가 노래를 진짜 잘한대.

en: From the way they talked, I presumed they were married.
ko: 걔네 말하는 걸 보니까 결혼한 것 같더라.

en: Both of them were not present at the meeting.
ko: 걔네 둘 다 회의에 안 왔어.

en: Their parents are older than ours.
ko: 걔네 부모님이 우리 부모님보다 연세가 많으셔.

en: Who will look after the baby while they're out?
ko: 걔네 나간 동안 누가 아기 봐줘?

en: Their trip was postponed because of the rain.
Their divorce is much talked about in their neighborhood.
Their divorce came as a complete surprise.
ko: 걔네 이혼 소식은 정말 완전 의외였어.

en: The school authorities started to take action at their request.
ko: 걔네가 요청해서 학교에서 조치를 취하기 시작했어.

en: You mustn't give in to their demands.
Don't give way to their request.
Their friendship ripened into a deep love.
By degrees their friendship grew into love.
ko: 걔네는 점점 친구에서 연인 사이가 됐어.

en: None of their promises have been kept.
Their eyes were all bright.
Their eyes pursued him.
They blotted out my name from the list.
Their names were erased from the list.
Their names are Tom and Ken.
Their names have already been signed.
Their names escaped me.
I couldn't remember their names.
Their dreams came true.
Informed of their safety, the premier breathed a sigh of relief.
ko: 걔네가 무사하다는 소식을 듣고 총리는 안도의 한숨을 내쉬었어.

en: Their nationalism was one cause of the war.
Their reports don't accord.
ko: 걔네 보고 내용이 서로 안 맞아.

en: Their manners and customs are different from those of this country.
ko: 걔네 풍습이나 관습은 여기랑은 좀 달라.

en: Their father had a large shoe shop in the town.
ko: 걔네 아버지는 동네에서 큰 신발 가게를 하셨어.

en: Their father is a taxi driver.
Their plane will soon take off.
Their complaints filled me with anger.
Their estimate of the cost was wide of the mark.
ko: 걔네가 예상한 비용이 실제랑은 너무 달랐어.

en: Their secret was laid bare.
All their secrets have been revealed.
Their opposition broke down.
They reveled in the success of their sales.
ko: 걔네는 판매가 대박 나서 신이 났어.

en: They are conventional in their judgement.
A fire broke out at the inn where they were staying.
ko: 걔네가 묵고 있던 숙소에 불이 났어.

en: The difference in their ages is six years.
Their farms adjoin.
Their patience was about to give out.
They lost their way; otherwise, they would have arrived long ago.
ko: 걔네가 길을 잃어서 그렇지, 아니었으면 벌써 도착했을 거야.

en: Their colleague was transferred to an overseas branch.
ko: 걔네 동료가 해외 지사로 발령 났어.

en: Their flight was discovered yesterday.
The battle ended before they got there.
Please tell me the precise time of their arrival.
Their late arrival was owing to the rain.
Their efforts were not for nothing.
Their efforts made the situation better to a certain degree.
ko: 걔네 노력 덕분에 상황이 어느 정도 나아졌어.

en: Their effort proved abortive.
Their efforts came to nothing.
All their efforts were in vain.
We cannot help admiring their effort.
ko: 걔네 노력은 정말 인정해줄 수밖에 없어.

en: Their traditional life style no longer exists.
ko: 걔네 전통적인 생활 방식은 이제 더 이상 없어.

en: Their proposal is out of the question.
Their proposition is contrary to ours.
Their garden is full of very beautiful flowers all the year round.
ko: 걔네 정원에는 일 년 내내 아주 예쁜 꽃들이 가득해.

en: The report proved true as a result of their investigation.
ko: 걔네 조사 결과 그 보고서는 사실로 밝혀졌어.

en: Their central concern was to have a big car.
ko: 걔네 주된 관심사는 큰 차를 갖는 거였어.

en: Some of them had a gift for making weapons.
ko: 걔들 중에 몇몇은 무기 만드는 데 재주가 있었어.

en: Some of them are healthy, but others are not.
ko: 걔들 중엔 건강한 애들도 있고, 아닌 애들도 있어.

en: Some of them are healthy, but some of them aren't.
ko: 걔들 중엔 건강한 애들도 있고, 안 건강한 애들도 있어.

en: Some of them are healthy, but others are not healthy.
ko: 걔들 중엔 건강한 애들도 있고, 건강하지 않은 애들도 있어.

en: I can never pick him out among them.
ko: 걔네들 사이에서 걔를 도저히 못 찾아내겠어.

en: Their clothes are quite like those of our ancestors.
ko: 걔네 옷은 우리 조상들 옷이랑 꽤 비슷해.

en: I anticipate that there will be problems on their expedition.
ko: 걔네 탐험에 문제가 생길 것 같아.

en: Problems are expected in their expedition.
ko: 걔네 탐험에 문제가 생길 거로 예상돼.

en: Who is their homeroom teacher?
They were, for the most part, college students.
Most of them were college students.
Most of them were university students.
They were mostly women.
They were for the most part high school students.
Many of them were kind to us.
ko: 걔들 중 많은 애가 우리한테 친절했어.

en: Their losses reached one million yen.
Their son grew bigger.
Their boy was named Edward.
Their son's name is John.
The dispute between them is due to misunderstanding.
Not all of them are present at the meeting today.
ko: 오늘 회의에 걔네가 다 온 건 아니야.

en: No one gave up hope.
There was a long winter before them.
ko: 걔네 앞에는 긴 겨울이 기다리고 있었어.

en: Their ship was at the mercy of the waves.
ko: 걔네 배가 파도에 휩쓸려 이리저리 휘둘렸어.

en: Their ship struck a rock.
Their baby has just started to crawl.
ko: 걔네 아기가 이제 막 기기 시작했어.

en: Their lifestyle is different to ours.
Their lifestyle is different from ours.
Are you in favor of their policy?
Their success has a lot to do with their diligence.
ko: 걔네 성공은 부지런한 거랑 관련이 깊어.

en: They are not much different in character from each other.
ko: 걔네는 성격이 서로 별로 다르지 않아.

en: Their view of life may appear strange.
ko: 걔네 인생관은 좀 이상하게 보일 수도 있어.

en: They have a growing population; therefore they need more and more food.
ko: 걔네는 인구가 늘고 있어서 음식이 점점 더 많이 필요해.

en: What happened to them is still a mystery.
ko: 걔네한테 무슨 일이 일어났는지는 여전히 수수께끼야.

en: Their intimacy grew with the years.
ko: 시간이 지나면서 걔네는 점점 더 친해졌어.

en: I was moved by their kindness.
Their offer cuts both ways.
Their lips met.
In their case, it was love at first sight.
ko: 걔네 같은 경우는 첫눈에 반한 거였어.

en: Their coats were uniform in color.
Their boss made them work against their will.
Their small protest triggered a mass demonstration.
ko: 걔네의 작은 항의가 대규모 시위로 이어졌어.

en: There is no need to call in their assistance.
But for their help, we could not have succeeded.
ko: 걔네 도움이 없었더라면 우린 성공하지 못했을 거야.

en: Their hobby is fishing.
I will have to help them.
Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
ko: 걔네 주요 수출품은 섬유인데, 특히 비단이랑 면이야.

en: Their car overtook ours.
I resent their rude attitude.
I'm angry because of their impolite attitude.
ko: 걔네의 무례한 태도 때문에 화가 나.

en: Their rude behavior makes me angry.
ko: 걔네의 무례한 행동이 날 화나게 해.

en: A lot of their time is spent on part-time jobs.
ko: 걔네 시간 대부분은 알바 하는 데 쓰여.

en: Their business came to a standstill for want of money.
Their business is expanding.
There is a community of thought between them.
Their manner of bringing up their children is extremely unusual.
ko: 걔네가 애들 키우는 방식은 진짜 특이해.

en: Their job is to exterminate rats and mice.
You can't judge their works by the same standards.
ko: 걔네 작품을 같은 기준으로 판단하면 안 돼.

en: Their finest moment is their last appearance on stage.
ko: 걔네의 최고의 순간은 무대에서의 마지막 모습이었어.

en: Their highest skill was woodworking.
I was quite taken aback at their bad manners.
Their way of thinking is behind the times.
You must take their ideas into account.
Their ideas seem totally alien to us.
ko: 걔네 생각은 우리한테 너무 생소하게 느껴져.

en: Their happiness was rooted in their industry.
We prayed for their happiness.
Their curiosity was aroused.
They heard a noise behind them.
Their employees live in.
As their language had no written form, the natives expressed deeds and events in carvings.
ko: 걔네 언어는 문자가 없어서 원주민들은 일어난 일들을 조각으로 표현했어.

en: It is silly of you to trust them.
ko: 걔네를 믿다니 너도 참 바보 같아.

en: You'd better do what they say.
ko: 걔네가 시키는 대로 하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: Their excuses were all alike.
It is not clearly stated in their study if the patients overcame this syndrome during the therapy.
ko: 걔네 연구에는 환자들이 치료 중에 이 증후군을 극복했는지 명확하게 안 나와 있어.

en: There is no telling how long their quarrel will last.
ko: 걔네 싸움이 얼마나 갈지는 아무도 몰라.

en: Their dog was so fierce that he kept everyone away.
ko: 걔네 개가 너무 사나워서 아무도 못 오게 했어.

en: Their blood will be distributed to many people.
ko: 걔네 피는 많은 사람들한테 나눠질 거야.

en: Their expenses for the wedding were considerable.
ko: 걔네 결혼식 비용이 꽤 많이 들었어.

en: Their married life was full bliss.
Their marriage broke up last year.
I hear their marriage is on the rocks and they'll probably file for divorce soon.
ko: 걔네 사이가 안 좋아서 조만간 이혼할 거래.

en: Their married life did not run smoothly.
Their wedding will be tomorrow.
Their wedding is tomorrow.
Their marriage ceremony was performed according to the custom of the district.
ko: 걔네 결혼식은 그 지역 관습에 따라 치러졌어.

en: Have you been invited to their wedding?
I was invited to their wedding.
Their plan sounds interesting to me.
Their decision will bring about serious consequences.
ko: 걔네의 결정은 심각한 결과를 가져올 거야.

en: I am quite ignorant of their plan.
ko: 걔네 계획에 대해서 난 아예 몰라.

en: I don't know anything about their plan.
Their plan resulted in failure.
I do not think their plan will work out.
ko: 걔네 계획이 잘될 것 같지 않아.

en: I don't think their plan will work out.
ko: 걔네 계획이 잘 안 풀릴 것 같아.

en: I don't think their plan will work.
ko: 걔네 계획이 통할 것 같지 않아.

en: I don't think that their plan will work.
ko: 걔네 계획이 먹힐 것 같지 않아.

en: I have doubts about the success of their plan.
Their contract is to run out at the end of this month.
ko: 걔네 계약 이번 달 말에 끝나.

en: Their muscles are stiff.
In the teeth of their strong opposition, we carried out our plan.
ko: 걔네가 엄청 반대하는데도 우리는 그냥 밀어붙였어.

en: Their living room is as large again as my house.
ko: 걔네 거실이 우리 집보다 두 배나 커.

en: Though I have done nothing against them, they think ill of me.
ko: 난 걔네한테 잘못한 것도 없는데 걔네는 날 안 좋게 봐.

en: From the way they look, I would say that they failed.
ko: 걔네 꼴을 보니까 실패한 것 같아.

en: I hope their relationship will blossom into something permanent.
ko: 걔네 관계가 계속 잘 이어졌으면 좋겠어.

en: A harmony prevailed among them.
There is a generation gap between them.
A fight started about nothing between them.
ko: 걔네 아무것도 아닌 일로 싸우기 시작했어.

en: Their bags were checked by security guards at the gate.
ko: 정문에서 보안 요원들이 걔네 가방을 검사했어.

en: Their school and ours are sister schools.
ko: 걔네 학교랑 우리 학교는 자매결연 맺은 사이야.

en: Their conversation was carried on for about an hour.
ko: 걔네 대화가 한 시간 정도 이어졌어.

en: Their conversation went on.
Their conversation being in Chinese, I was not able to understand them at all.
ko: 걔네 중국어로 대화해서 난 하나도 못 알아들었어.

en: Their assignments were handed in on September 1st.
Their home is abundant in love and laughter.
Their furniture is more aesthetic than practical.
Their furniture was chosen for utility rather than style.
ko: 걔네 가구는 스타일보다는 실용성을 보고 고른 거야.

en: Stone was used to build their houses.
ko: 걔네 집 짓는 데 돌이 쓰였어.

en: Their house is off the map, miles away from the nearest town.
ko: 걔네 집은 지도에도 안 나올 만큼 마을에서 엄청 멀어.

en: Theirs is an old family.
Their house is far from the station.
Their house is being remodeled.
Their house was burned down in the fire.
Their dining room is very spacious.
They were very kind to me when I was at their house.
ko: 걔네 집에 있을 때 걔네가 나한테 진짜 잘해줬어.

en: Some of them are my friends.
ko: 걔네 중 몇 명은 내 친구야.

en: Some of them said yes, and the others said no.
ko: 걔네 중 누구는 좋다고 하고 누구는 싫다고 했어.

en: The warmth of their welcome made me happy.
It took us a week to locate their hideaway.
ko: 걔네 은신처를 찾아내는 데 일주일 걸렸어.

en: It took one week to locate their hiding place.
ko: 걔네가 숨어 있는 곳을 찾는 데 일주일이 걸렸어.

en: Their opinions differ from mine.
Their opinion matters little.
Each of their opinions has both good points and bad points.
Even after being approved, difficulties might arise in the actual construction of the line.
ko: 승인되더라도 실제 노선 공사에서는 어려움이 생길 수도 있어.

en: It is your business to take care of them.
ko: 걔네 챙기는 건 네가 할 일이야.

en: They are mostly polite.
I guess most of them went home.
I think most of them took part in the plot.
ko: 걔네 대부분이 그 음모에 가담한 것 같아.

en: Shall I carry coffee to them?
Their boat needs painting.
Their team's name is NWO.
Their team doesn't have a ghost of a chance of winning this season.
ko: 걔네 팀 이번 시즌에 우승할 가능성 전혀 없어.
